main event: A flaming green object streaked over Michigan on February 24, 1959, as reported by multiple witnesses including control tower operators and excited citizens who saw the object.
interesting points: The object was described as 'blush green' and appeared to be disintegrating as it traveled from east to west.
It was also sighted at airport control towers in Chicago and Madison, Wis, indicating a widespread sighting.
Radio station WKAR in Houghton Lake received a call from a scared witness who described the object as it scared him.
The sighting was believed to be a meteorite and was visible for 3-4 seconds before disintegrating.
The report suggests that the object was probably a large star and the duration reported is long for a meteor but does not rule out the possibility of a meteor.
sighted object: flaming green object streaking across the sky
location: Rapid City, Mich. and other areas in Michigan, Chicago, and Madison
witnesses: Control tower operators, excited citizens, and a scared witness
photographs: yes, the report includes a photograph of a newspaper article
